IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROVIDE QUALITY HEALTH CARE TO ANY PERSON REGARDLESS OF RACE, COLOR, CREED, NATIONAL ORIGIN, AGE, SEX, HANDICAP AND/OR ABILITY TO PAY.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO PROVIDE QUALITY HEALTH CARE TO ANY PERSON REGARDLESS OF RACE, COLOR, CREED, NATIONAL ORIGIN, AGE, SEX, HANDICAP AND/OR ABILITY TO PAY.
IRS990.Description: MINERS HOSPITAL IS A COMMUNITY HOSPITAL SERVING FAMILIES ACROSS RURAL NORTHERN CAMBRIA COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN PENNSYLVANIA. THE HOSPITAL SPECIALIZES IN FAMILY AND PRIMARY CARE, AND HAS 30 BEDS FOR MEDICAL/SURGICAL AND INTENSIVE CARE SERVICES.DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 2010, THE HOSPITAL ADMITTED 850 PATIENTS; HAD 10,698 EMERGENCY VISITS; AND PERFORMED 2,065 SURGICAL PROCEDURES. ALSO, THE HOSPITAL PROVIDED CHARITY CARE AT COST IN THE AMOUNT OF $210,907.

ContractorCompensation.DescriptionOfServices: FINANCIAL, IT, CLINICAL DOC, SLEEP LAB/E

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: THE HOSPITAL PAID ANNUAL DUES TO THE HOSPITAL COUNCIL OF WESTERN PA (HCWP), A 501(C)(6) CORPORATION. ACCORDING TO HCWP, TEN PERCENT OF DUES ARE UTILIZED FOR LOBBYING AND PUBLIC POLICY DEVELOPMENT.

OtherLiabilities.Description: DUE TO CONEMAUGH HEALTH INITIATIVES, INC.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: FASB ISSUED ASC TOPIC 740 CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTITY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND MEASUREMENT ATTRIBUTE FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN, OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. TOPIC 740 ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON DESCRIPTION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, ACCOUNTING IN INTERIM PERIODS, DISCLOSURE AND TRANSITION. CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS RECOGNIZED FOR 2010 OR 2009.

Form990ScheduleHPartVI.BadDebtFootnote: Part III, Line 4: PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE FOR SERVICES RENDERED ARE REPORTED AT NET REALIZABLE AMOUNTS FROM THIRD-PARTY PAYORS, PATIENTS AND OTHERS. CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM (CHS) PROVIDES AN ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS BASED UPON A REVIEW OF OUTSTANDING RECEIVABLES, HISTORICAL COLLECTION INFORMATION AND EXISTING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS. AS A SERVICE TO THE PATIENT, CHS BILLS THIRD-PARTY PAYORS DIRECTLY AND BILLS THE PATIENT WHEN THE PATIENT'S LIABILITY IS DETERMINED. PATIENT ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE ARE DUE IN FULL WHEN BILLED. ACCOUNTS ARE CONSIDERED DELINQUENT AND SUBSEQUENTLY WRITTEN OFF AS BAD DEBTS BASED ON INDIVIDUAL CREDIT EVALUATION AND SPECIFIC CIRCUMSTANCES OF THE ACCOUNT.THE METHODOLOGY UTILIZED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT REPORTED ON LINE 2 IS BASED ON THE ORGANIZATION'S COST TO CHARGE RATIO. THE METHODOLOGY FOR LINE 3 IS BASED ON A PREDICTIVE ANALYSIS SCORING SYSTEM DEVELOPED BY ACUMEN THAT WAS APPLIED TO ALL OUTSTANDING SELF PAY ACCOUNTS IN FISCAL YEAR 2010. THIS SCORING PROGRAM CONSISTS OF A FOUR DIGIT SCORE; THE FIRST TWO DIGITS ARE BASED UPON THE FEDERAL POVERTY GUIDELINES AND THE LAST TWO DIGITS ARE THE PROBABILITY/PROPENSITY TO PAY SCORE. THE ACCOUNTS THAT WERE INCLUDED IN THE STUDY WERE SEGREGATED BASED ON MEDIAN HOUSEHOLD INCOME AND AVERAGE HOUSEHOLD SIZE ABOVE AND BELOW 150% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY GUIDELINES. THE NUMBER OF ACCOUNTS THAT FELL BELOW THAT THRESHOLD WERE PRESUMED TO POTENTIALLY QUALIFY FOR CHARITY CARE. THE PERCENTAGES WERE THEN DERIVED FROM THE NUMBER OF ACCOUNTS FALLING BELOW THAT THRESHOLD BY THE TOTAL NUMBER OF OUTSTANDING ACCOUNTS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.ShortfallAsCommunityBenefit: Part III, Line 8: CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM UTILIZES MCKESSON'S HORIZON PERFORMANCE MANAGER (HPM) FOR COST ACCOUNTING. HPM PROVIDES THE ABILITY TO ALLOCATE ALL DEPARTMENTAL EXPENSES AT THE INDIVIDUAL CHARGE FOR EACH CHARGING DEPARTMENT, AS WELL AS ALLOCATE OVERHEAD EXPENSES IN A CONSISTENT MANNER. THE ENCOUNTER COSTING FUNCTIONALITY OF HPM PROVIDES THE ABILITY TO THEN DETERMINE AN ACCURATE ESTIMATE OF COST AT THE PATIENT LEVEL BASED ON THE CHARGE UNIT COSTS. THE SYSTEM THEN PROVIDES THE ABILITY TO SUMMARIZE THE PATIENT VOLUME, CHARGES, AND COSTS IN ANY NUMBER OF WAYS, INCLUDING PAYER SPECIFIC COST ALLOCATION.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.GeneralExplanation: PART I, LINE 3B: SEE ATTACHED TABLE FOR SPECIFIC INCOME GUIDELINES RELATED TO PARTIAL CHARITY CARE (DISCOUNTED CARE).
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.NeedsAssessment: Part VI, Line 2: THE CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM IS AN ACTIVE MEMBER OF THE COMMUNITY AND AN ADVOCATE FOR THE HEALTH, WELL BEING AND ECONOMIC STRENGTH OF THE REGION. CHS ADMINISTRATORS HAVE TEAMED UP WITH THE UNITED WAY OF THE LAUREL HIGHLANDS OVER THE PAST FEW YEARS TO WORK TO IDENTIFY AND PRIORITIZE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES THAT CAN BEST IMPACT THE MOST SIGNIFICANT NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY (CAMBRIA AND SOMERSET COUNTIES). CHS LEADERS HAVE SERVED IN MANY ROLES INCLUDING CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD, CHAIRMAN OF THE COMMUNITY IMPACT COMMITTEE, AND PARTICIPATION IN THE LOANED EXECUTIVE PROGRAM. LEADERS HAVE ALSO SERVED IN MANY OF THE UNITED WAY MEMBERSHIP ORGANIZATIONS INCLUDING THE WOMEN'S HELP CENTER, SALVATION ARMY, NATIONAL ALLIANCE ON MENTAL ILLNESS AND THE UNITED WAY OF THE LAUREL HIGHLANDS FOOD PANTRY.CHS AND THE UNITED WAY ARE NOW COLLECTING DATA FOR A 2011 COMMUNITY NEEDS ANALYSIS, WHICH WILL BE PRESENTED AND DISTRIBUTED BROADLY. CHS AND THE UNITED WAY HAVE ALSO COMMITTED TO MONITOR THE IMPACT OF PROGRAMMING IN PRIORITY AREAS AND REALLOCATE RESOURCES TO DRIVE RESULTS. THE NORTHERN CAMBRIA REGION, SERVED BY MINERS HOSPITAL, WILL BE INCLUDED IN THIS REPORT.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.PatientEducationAssistance: Part VI, Line 3: CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM COMMUNICATES TO PATIENTS THE AVAILABILITY OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE UNDER FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL PROGRAMS, AS WELL AS THE CHARITY CARE PROGRAM, ON OUR WEBSITE, WHICH INCLUDES A DOWNLOADABLE CHARITY CARE APPLICATION AND INSTRUCTIONS. TABLE TOP BROCHURES ARE PROVIDED AT ALL POINTS OF REGISTRATION, AND BROCHURES ARE INCLUDED IN PATIENT ADMISSION PACKETS. INFORMATION ON THE AVAILABILITY OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS ALSO INCLUDED ON PATIENT STATEMENTS. ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED TO PATIENTS TO APPLY FOR MEDICAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH A THIRD-PARTY VENDOR. A ROBUST FINANCIAL COUNSELING AND CUSTOMER SERVICE DEPARTMENT IS AVAILABLE TO HANDLE SPECIFIC PATIENT NEEDS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.CommunityInformation: Part VI, Line 4: MINERS HOSPITAL (MINERS) IS A 30 BED, STATE-OF-THE-ART COMMUNITY HOSPITAL SERVING FAMILIES ACROSS RURAL NORTHERN CAMBRIA COUNTY. IT IS THE REGION'S SOLE HOSPITAL AND SPECIALIZES IN FAMILY AND PRIMARY CARE. ITS PARTNERSHIP WITH THE CONEMAUGH VALLEY MEMORIAL HOSPITAL MEANS THAT ITS SMALL SIZE IS NO BARRIER TO PROVIDING PATIENTS WITH ACCESS TO SPECIALISTS OR NEW TECHNOLOGIES. IN FACT, SPECIALTY SERVICES ARE AVAILABLE ONSITE SEVERAL TIMES PER WEEK.MINERS PROVIDES 24/7 EMERGENCY CARE AND HAS GENERAL AND ORTHOPEDIC SURGEONS ON SITE. LABORATORY SERVICES ARE PERFORMED AROUND THE CLOCK AND THERE IS AN ONSITE PHARMACY ENHANCING PATIENT CARE. ACCOMODATIONS HAVE BEEN MADE TO IMPROVE ACCESS FOR PATIENTS NEEDING RADIOLOGY SERVICES BY OFFERING CT SCAN, ULTRASOUND, MAMMOGRAPHY, AND MOBILE MRI AS WELL AS ROUTINE RADIOLOGY STUDIES. PATHOLOGY, PHYSICAL THERAPY AND RESPIRATORY CARE ARE AVAILABLE AT MINERS AS WELL AS OB/GYN OUTPATIENT CARE.PHYSICIAN SPECIALISTS VISIT PATIENTS AT MINERS SEVERAL TIMES PER WEEK OR MONTH INCLUDING CARDIOLOGY, UROLOGY, OPHTHALMOLOGY, GASTROENTEROLOGY, NEPHROLOGY, NEUROLOGY AND PULMONOLOGY. THIS IS DONE FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF PATIENTS AND TO CUT DOWN ON TRAVEL TIME FOR PATIENTS.DEMOGRAPHICALLY, NEARLY 20 PERCENT OF RESIDENTS IN THE CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM SERVICE AREA ARE 65 OR OLDER, ONE OF THE HIGHEST PERCENTAGES IN THE STATE AND WELL ABOVE THE PENNSYLVANIA AVERAGE OF 15.3 PERCENT. THE PAYOR MIX FOR OUR REGION IS SKEWED HEAVILY TOWARD MEDICARE AND MEDICAID. AT 9.7 PERCENT, THE CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM'S SERVICE AREA HAS ONE OF THE STATE'S HIGHEST UNEMPLOYMENT RATES, AND MEDIAN HOUSEHOLD INCOMES OF $34,000 LAG 30 PERCENT BEHIND STATE AND NATIONAL AVERAGES. THE DEMOGRAPHIC MAKE UP OF THE REGION IS CONSIDERED WHEN PLANNING EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES AND HEALTH INFORMATION PROGRAMS.THE CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM'S COVERAGE REGION ALSO PRESENTS SOME GEOGRAPHIC CHALLENGES. MOUNTAINOUS TOPOGRAPHY AND HIGHWAY INFRASTRUCTURE MAKE TIMELY TRAVEL A CONCERN FOR SOME PATIENTS. CHS CONTINUES TO LOOK FOR OPPORTUNITIES TO BRING PRIMARY CARE AND PHYSICIAN SPECIALISTS TO RURAL REGIONS OF THE MARKET. IN THE PAST YEAR, A CONCENTRATED EFFORT HAS BEEN MADE TO DEVELOP AND DELIVER HEALTH AND WELLNESS EDUCATION AND SCREENINGS TO CONSTITUENTS IN RURAL REGIONS. WHEN POSSIBLE, CHS TEAMS UP WITH OTHER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS TO DELIVER THESE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO RURAL CONSTITUENTS.
Form990ScheduleHPartVI.OtherInformation: Part VI, Line 6: MINERS HOSPITAL TAKES PART IN A NUMBER OF COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES EACH YEAR. THESE INCLUDE A KID SKINS SPORTS PHYSICAL PROGRAM, WHICH PROVIDES FREE PHYSICALS FOR APPROXIMATELY 150 YOUNGSTERS PARTICIPATING IN FALL SPORTS. PHYSICIANS AND OTHER CLINICAL STAFF VOLUNTEER THEIR TIME FOR THIS INITIATIVE.INTERNSHIPS AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES ARE OFFERED TO VARIOUS TYPES OF STUDENTS INCLUDING PHYSICIAN ASSISTANT, RN, LPN, RADIOLOGY TECHNOLOGY, PHLEBOTOMY AND HEALTHCARE ADMINISTRATION THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH VARIOUS UNIVERSITIES INCLUDING ST. FRANCIS AND MOUNT ALOYSIUS, AS WELL AS THE PENNSYLVANIA HIGHLANDS COMMUNITY COLLEGE.SMOKING CESSATION, WEIGHT MANAGEMENT AND DIABETES EDUCATION CLASSES ARE ALL OFFERED AT MINERS HOSPITAL TO HELP PATIENTS IN THE NORTHERN CAMBRIA COUNTY REGION RECEIVE EDUCATION TO HELP THEM MAKE HEALTHY CHOICES. IN ADDITION, VARIOUS FREE SCREENINGS HAVE TAKEN PLACE AT MINERS INCLUDING RESPIRATORY SCREENINGS, SLEEP APNEA MASK FIT TESTING AND BLOOD SCREENINGS. A TEDDY BEAR CLINIC IS ALSO HELD EACH YEAR TO ENGAGE WITH CHILDREN IN THE AREA.MINERS HOSPITAL FACILITY HIGHLIGHTS:LICENSED PATIENT BEDS - 30PATIENT DAYS OF SERVICE - 3,714INPATIENT DAILY CENSUS - 10ADJUSTED PATIENT DAYS - 18,862ADMISSIONS - 850AVERAGE LENGTH OF STAY - 4FULL TIME EQUIVALENT EMPLOYEES - 126VOLUNTEERS - 16PHYSICIANS:ACTIVE - 16COURTESY - 33CONSULTING - 28ALLIED HEALTH - 19SERVICES:EMERGENCY VISITS - 10,698INPATIENT SURGERIES - 207SAME DAY/AMBULATORY SURGERIES - 1,858OUTPATIENT CLINIC VISITS - 52,668LABORATORY TESTS - 205,622RADIOLOGY EXAMS - 12,520ULTRASOUND PROCEDURES - 4,138CT SCANS - 4,929MRI PROCEDURES - 790NUCLEAR MEDICINE EXAMS - 931RESPIRATORY THERAPY PROCEDURES - 41,813EKG'S, EEG'S, HOLTERS - 3,131AMBULATORY SURGERY UNIT VISITS - 1,983

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS PARTICIPATED IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN. THE AMOUNTS RELATED TO THIS PLAN, WHICH ARE INCLUDED IN THE DEFERRED COMPENSATION SHOWN ARE: SCOTT BECKER $92,650; EDWARD DEPASQUALE $44,214; DAVID CARLSON, DO $57,443; JOSEPH DADO $35,863; STEVEN TUCKER $44,214; AND WILLIAM CROWE $16,503.

WILLIAM CROWE RECEIVED A BONUS FROM MINERS HOSPITAL. SCOTT BECKER, EDWARD DEPASQUALE, DAVID CARLSON, DO, AND JOSEPH DADO RECEIVED A BONUS FROM THE CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM, A RELATED ORGANIZATION. STEVEN TUCKER RECEIVED A BONUS FROM MEMORIAL MEDICAL CENTER, A RELATED ORGANIZATION. EXECUTIVE BONUSES ARE CALCULATED AS A PERCENTAGE OF BASE SALARY. THE PERCENTAGE IS CONTINGENT ON VARIOUS FINANCIAL AND NON-FINANCIAL CRITERIA, GOVERNED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE SOLE MEMBERS OF MINERS HOSPITAL ARE THE NORTHERN CAMBRIA HEALTHCARE FOUNDATION AND THE CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM, INC.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM, INC. HAS THE POWER TO APPROVE OR DISAPPROVE THE ELECTION OF OR REMOVAL OF MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ALL DECISIONS OF THE GOVERNING BODY OF MINERS HOSPITAL ARE SUBJECT TO APPROVAL BY THE CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM, INC.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE IT IS FILED. ONCE THE FORM IS COMPLETE, BOARD MEMBERS ARE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO REVIEW THE CONTENTS OF THE FORM AND SUBMIT ANY COMMENTS OR QUESTIONS. IN ADDITION, SINCE THE ORGANIZATION IS A SUBSIDIARY WITHIN A LARGER HEALTH SYSTEM, THE FORM IS REVIEWED BY THE HEALTH SYSTEM'S MANAGER, TAX & COMPLIANCE; DIRECTOR, FINANCIAL OPERATIONS; VICE PRESIDENT, FINANCIAL OPERATIONS; CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER; AND THE AUDIT AND COMPLIANCE COMMITTEE. AN EXTERNAL CPA FIRM IS ENGAGED TO REVIEW AND ELECTRONICALLY FILE THE RETURN.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION IS A SUBSIDIARY OF A LARGER HEALTH SYSTEM AND IS GOVERNED BY THE SYSTEM'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. UNDER THIS POLICY, EVERY BOARD MEMBER IS GIVEN A COPY OF THE POLICY AS WELL AS A FORM THAT MUST BE COMPLETED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. NO BOARD MEMBER IS APPROVED OR RE-APPOINTED UNTIL HE OR SHE HAS COMPLETED AND SIGNED THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM. ONCE THE FORM IS RETURNED, IT IS REVIEWED BY THE SYSTEM'S COMPLIANCE OFFICER AND CEO. IF ANY CONFLICTS ARE DISCLOSED, THE DETAILS ARE FORWARDED TO THE BOARD CHAIR TO BE ADDRESSED. DEPENDING ON THE CONFLICT, THE BOARD MEMBER COULD BE GIVEN CERTAIN RESTRICTIONS, SUCH AS BEING PROHIBITED FROM PARTICIPATING IN CERTAIN BOARD DECISIONS. THE HEALTH SYSTEM'S AUDIT AND COMPLIANCE COMMITTEE HAS THE FINAL DECISION-MAKING REGARDING ALL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. THROUGHOUT THE FISCAL YEAR, BOARD MEMBERS MUST NOTIFY THE BOARD CHAIR, COMPLIANCE OFFICER, AND/OR CEO IF A NEW CONFLICT OF INTEREST HAS DEVELOPED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S PARENT, A HEALTH SYSTEM, MANAGES THE DETERMINATION OF COMPENSATION AND THE PROCESS IS OUTLINED IN ITS BYLAWS. TWO OUTSIDE CONSULTING FIRMS ARE UTILIZED TO ENSURE THAT EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION PACKAGES ARE FAIR AND COMPARABLE WITH SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS. THE HEALTH SYSTEM HAS ALSO ESTABLISHED AN EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE TO REVIEW AND RECOMMEND THE COMPENSATION DECISIONS MADE. THIS COMMITTEE REPORTS DIRECTLY TO THE HEALTH SYSTEM'S BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION IS PART OF A HEALTH SYSTEM AND ALL REQUESTS FOR THIS INFORMATION ARE HANDLED BY THE SYSTEM'S MARKETING/PUBLIC RELATIONS DEPARTMENT.

PART XI, LINE 2: THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 2010 WERE AUDITED AS PART OF THE AUDIT OF THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE CONEMAUGH HEALTH SYSTEM, INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES. THE HEALTH SYSTEM'S AUDIT AND COMPLIANCE COMMITTEE ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND THE SELECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.

MEYERSDALE COMMUNITY HOSPITAL DBA MEYERSDALE MEDICAL CENTER
